New Records: The 30-point defeat marks the largest margin of loss in a season opener in franchise history, surpassing the previous record of 29 points set in their 2001 season opener
Key Match Events: Cleveland rallied, closing the first quarter with a 13-5 run to take a 33-32 lead. The Cavaliers never trailed again
Miscellaneous Highlights: A sold-out crowd of 19,800 fans, including former Raptors players from the past 29 seasons and recently inducted Hall of Famer Vince Carter, filled the arena
Others: Guard Immanuel Quickley, who also re-signed with a five-year contract extension, left the game in the second quarter with a right pelvic injury
